members.biography:
Dion GrausSummaryDion Graus (1967) was born in Heerlen and lives in Heerlen. He is in total 6949 days active in the House of Representatives.More infoEducation and careerExtra activities, travel and giftsSocial media linksEmailXLinkedIn

Dion Graus (1967) was born in Heerlen and lives in Heerlen. He is in total 6949 days active in the House of Representatives.

More infoEducation and careerExtra activities, travel and gifts

Biography“Making the Netherlands a better place for people and animals”My fight is against indecency and rudeness and I want to make the Netherlands a better place for people and animals alike. We should have more respect for the elderly, who built the economy we rely on today. On top of that, I spent many years fighting for animals to be given the right to protection, care and welfare and will continue to do so. I see myself as a colourful representative of the people, not yet another grey politician. And that’s who I want to be as an MP: a man who fights for people and animals. Castles still exist, but knights and patriotism have disappeared.EducationHBO ManagementPhytotherapyVWOCareerTV producer/presenter 2003-2006Manager, Nutraceuticals Chassot/Vétoquinol Benelux 2002-2003Managing director, Anisane/ Chassot NL 1999-2002Veterinary sales representative, AST-Farma 1997-1999Various postions in sales, marketing, PR managemnet in the automotive sector 1991-1996CommitteesAgriculture, Fisheries, Food Security and NatureClimate Policy and Green GrowthEconomic AffairsEuropean AffairsFinanceHealth, Welfare and SportInfrastructure and Water Management

Biography“Making the Netherlands a better place for people and animals”My fight is against indecency and rudeness and I want to make the Netherlands a better place for people and animals alike. We should have more respect for the elderly, who built the economy we rely on today. On top of that, I spent many years fighting for animals to be given the right to protection, care and welfare and will continue to do so. I see myself as a colourful representative of the people, not yet another grey politician. And that’s who I want to be as an MP: a man who fights for people and animals. Castles still exist, but knights and patriotism have disappeared.EducationHBO ManagementPhytotherapyVWOCareerTV producer/presenter 2003-2006Manager, Nutraceuticals Chassot/Vétoquinol Benelux 2002-2003Managing director, Anisane/ Chassot NL 1999-2002Veterinary sales representative, AST-Farma 1997-1999Various postions in sales, marketing, PR managemnet in the automotive sector 1991-1996

My fight is against indecency and rudeness and I want to make the Netherlands a better place for people and animals alike. We should have more respect for the elderly, who built the economy we rely on today. On top of that, I spent many years fighting for animals to be given the right to protection, care and welfare and will continue to do so. I see myself as a colourful representative of the people, not yet another grey politician. And that’s who I want to be as an MP: a man who fights for people and animals. Castles still exist, but knights and patriotism have disappeared.
